results.title: Interactions between Angiotensin Type-1 Antagonists, Statins, and ROCK Inhibitors in a Rat Model of L-DOPA-Induced Dyskinesia
results.text_hl: When @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with already established @DISEASE_Dyskinesia_Drug_Induced @DISEASE_MESH:D004409 @@@dyskinesia@@@ were treated with the same dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (15 mg/kg, orally) for a period of 10 days, the decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Palsy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002547 @@@dyskinetic@@@ behavior was not significant (Figure 4C).

citations.NLM: Lopez-Lopez A, Valenzuela R, Rodriguez-Perez AI, Guerra MJ, Labandeira-Garcia JL, Muñoz A. Interactions between Angiotensin Type-1 Antagonists, Statins, and ROCK Inhibitors in a Rat Model of L-DOPA-Induced Dyskinesia Antioxidants (Basel). 2023 Jul 19;12(7):. PMID: 37507992
citations.BibTeX: @article{37507992, title={Interactions between Angiotensin Type-1 Antagonists, Statins, and ROCK Inhibitors in a Rat Model of L-DOPA-Induced Dyskinesia}, author={Lopez-Lopez A and Valenzuela R and Rodriguez-Perez AI and Guerra MJ and Labandeira-Garcia JL and Muñoz A}, journal={Antioxidants (Basel)}, volume={12}, number={7}}

results.title: Combined therapy with simvastatin and bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells increases benefits in infarcted swine hearts.
results.text_hl: At 6 weeks, MRI showed the number of @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Palsy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002547 @@@dyskinetic@@@ segments and the @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ size were significantly decreased in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIMV@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Yang YJ, Qian HY, Huang J, Li JJ, Gao RL, Dou KF, Yang GS, Willerson JT, Geng YJ. Combined therapy with simvastatin and bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells increases benefits in infarcted swine hearts. Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol. 2009 Dec;29(12):2076-82. PMID: 19762786
citations.BibTeX: @article{19762786, title={Combined therapy with simvastatin and bone marrow-derived mesenchymal stem cells increases benefits in infarcted swine hearts.}, author={Yang YJ and Qian HY and Huang J and Li JJ and Gao RL and Dou KF and Yang GS and Willerson JT and Geng YJ}, journal={Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol}, volume={29}, number={12}, pages={2076-82}}

results.title: Lipid-lowering drugs prevent neurovascular and cognitive consequences of cardiopulmonary bypass.
results.text_hl: In a @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model of CPB, we demonstrated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ protected against CPB-induced @DISEASE_Vascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D014652 @@@endothelial dysfunction@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Palsy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002547 @@@cerebral and systemic@@@ @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ in parallel to @DISEASE_Memory_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D008569 @@@memory impairment@@@ prevention.

citations.NLM: Ouk T, Amr G, Azzaoui R, Delassus L, Fossaert E, Tailleux A, Bordet R, Modine T. Lipid-lowering drugs prevent neurovascular and cognitive consequences of cardiopulmonary bypass. Vascul Pharmacol. 2016 May;80():59-66. PMID: 26779598
citations.BibTeX: @article{26779598, title={Lipid-lowering drugs prevent neurovascular and cognitive consequences of cardiopulmonary bypass.}, author={Ouk T and Amr G and Azzaoui R and Delassus L and Fossaert E and Tailleux A and Bordet R and Modine T}, journal={Vascul Pharmacol}, volume={80}, pages={59-66}}

results.title: Simvastatin Reduces Lipopolysaccharides-Accelerated Cerebral Ischemic Injury via Inhibition of Nuclear Factor-kappa B Activity
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ was administrated orally 4 times at 72, 48, 25 and 1 h before the induction of the @<m>DISEASE_Cerebral_Palsy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002547 @@@cerebral ischemic@@@ insult.

citations.NLM: Anthony Jalin AM, Lee JC, Cho GS, Kim C, Ju C, Pahk K, Song HY, Kim WK. Simvastatin Reduces Lipopolysaccharides-Accelerated Cerebral Ischemic Injury via Inhibition of Nuclear Factor-kappa B Activity Biomol Ther (Seoul). 2015 Nov;23(6):531-8. PMID: 26535078
